newsitem.title: USA: TRW to cut 2,300 jobs, close plants.
newsitem.headline: TRW to cut 2,300 jobs, close plants.

text.p: TRW Inc said Monday it will cut 2,300 jobs and close or consolidate a number of manufacturing facilities after it reported $233.4 million in after-tax third quarter charges.

The company said the charges related to the reconfiguration of its automotive manufacturing plants, litigation and warranty expenses, contract and employee benefit reserves and impaired asset writedowns.
As a result, the company said, it will close or consolidate several manufacturing facilities and cut employment company-wide by about 2,300.
The facilites to be affected are automotive parts-making plants. Two are in Michigan, one is in Texas and one is in Ontario, said company spokesman Jay McCaffrey.
McCaffrey said the job cuts would come from these facilities and elsewhere.
